workout_file.description: Strength training: A certain repetition of short and maximal efforts with the goal to increase neuromuscular recruitment and maximum specific strength.
workout_file.name: Week 1.2 - Strength

textevent.message: Welcome back to the 2nd workout of the 6 week FTP Builder!
We're going to start with another progressive warmup today. Make sure you have your towel, fluids, and fan ready.
Hopefully, you weren't too tired from our first workout, but if you were, that's okay.
Like we said before, you need to create an overload for your body to respond to.
1min to go here, then we're going to keep our ramp going at a slightly faster cadence.
In 10sec, let's continue the warmup, but at 90 RPM.
Keep on warming up here, nice and steady as we go through the zones.
Let's take a moment now to chat about what we have in store for today's workout...
Today is our first 'strength' day and involves doing repeated short and FULL GAS efforts.
To increase our neuromuscular recruitment and maximum specific strength.
Improving our neuromuscular recruitment will result in enhanced contractile strength.
And since we're on a bike, it's specific strength.
Simply put, today's workout aims to improve the amount of force you can produce.
We'll be doing 2 sets of 5, 10sec FULL GAS sprints, with just under 2min rest between each sprint.
And, 10min between each interval set. So, only 100sec worth of actual work today, but don't be fooled by that :-)
We're going to continue our ramp, but next up at 100 RPM!
Let's get those pedals turning even faster now!
No bouncing or lurching in the saddle now. Aim for smoothness.
1min to go! You should be sweating nicely now, which means you're ready to work!
GREAT! That's it for today's warmup. Let's bring it down easy for a bit and get ready for the main set.
Take some deep breaths, and a few sips of fluid. We'll catch up with 1min to go.
All right in 1min, we have our first sprint effort. Ideally, these are best done with ERG off.
You can turn it off through the Zwift Companion app, or by pressing up on the keyboard.
This is ideal since ERG won't respond fast enough, and I want you to smash these!
After the sprint, you may turn ERG back on again for the rest break.
Speaking of the sprint, aim to do these seated to engage maximum muscular engagement and get into a big gear now.
Okay, ready? In 10 sec, SMASH IT! Big gear, and fast cadence going for MAX POWER.
Great work! You can turn ERG back on now if you'd like, but no worries if you do not want to.
We're going to take just under 2min of rest in between each sprint effort.
Use this time to take a few deep breaths, shake out the legs and upper body, and a sip of fluid.
All right, sprint effort #2 is coming up! ERG mode off again and get ready to PUSH.
Excellent! That's 2 down, 3 more to go. Doing these seated should feel a lot different.
And you should feel your hips and glutes working much more.
Get ready for another sprint!!
Beautiful effort! Hopefully, you're able to produce a little more power with each interval.
Let's take a few deep breaths again now, and a sip of fluids. We have 2 more to go.
Get back into that big gear again, almost GO time!
YES! That was a great one! Just 1 more to go, then we'll take a nice long rest.
Breathe, relax, and let go of the tension in your shoulders here.
Okay, ready? Grab those bars, grit those teeth, and CRUSH THIS!
Awesome! That's it for the first set. Let's take a nice full recovery now.
10min is a long time, but necessary to fully recover from those sprint efforts!
Let's continue to take it easy here, nothing substantial on the legs and a light spin.
We'll catch up with 1min to go.
All right! You should feel recovered by now and ready to get back to work!
We have another set of 5, seated sprints coming up next.
And just under 2min of recovery between.
I want you to aim for absolute max power again with these, and DRIVE those pedals!
Ready? ERG off again, please, unless it already is.
Great! Feeling like the legs are a bit more fatigued relative to the first set is typical and expected.
Just do your best and produce those watts!!
Here we go again...
Excellent effort! Only 3 more sprints to go, and we're done today!
Breathe and relax again here. Make sure you're still drinking too.
Get back into that big gear...Get ready to GO!
Way to go! That's 3 down, and just 2 more to go. You're crushing it today!
Keep yourself focused on the task at hand today. Just 20sec of hard work left!
Okay ready? Grab those bars and prepare to DIG!
Phew! Only 1 more to go :-) Rest up and recover as best you can.
I want the last one to be the best!
Okay, ready? Empty the tanks on this one!
NICE JOB!! That's it for the work today. Let's start to cool down now.
We'll get a nice and full 10min cool down in today to flush out the legs from those efforts
You may experience some soreness tomorrow after a session like this, which is normal.
Do your best to get some extra sleep, and eat a well-balanced diet to aid in recovery.
Enjoy the last few minutes of the cool down, and we'll see you next time!
